result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jason Lockery
Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Br 3 Judge on 08/04/22 sp)
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:10 PM . Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trey Riley Barforth in court and in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Trey Riley Barforth. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order to Transport /s/ PB 07/20/22
Order to Transport filed by the State (Sent to Br 3 Judge on 07/19/22 sp)
No contact with Kwik Trip or BP as listed in the criminal complaint

2:11 PM Defendant Trey Riley Barforth appeared by video, in custody from the Fond Du Lac County Jail.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Trey Riley Barforth. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney WILL NOT waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
State to complete an Order to Transport
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
not mailed as the State will be doing an "Order to Transport" sp

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant believes he has Attorney (Atty) Bergner.  Court informs the defendant to contact the public defender office. 
Court reschedules.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trey Riley Barforth appeared by video from Fond du Lac County jail, in custody. 
Defendant states he did not receive the criminal complaint.
Matter is rescheduled.
Court informs what the charges are and that the District Attorney is sending the complaint.
Defendant is waiting to be sentenced for a case in Fond du Lac County.
Bond will be addressed at the next hearing.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trey Riley Barforth not in court. 

Atty Mutchler indicates Atty Bergner just informed him that he may be in the Fond Du Lac County jail but he has not confirmed that.  Asks to adjourn the matter.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:01 PM Defendant Trey Riley Barforth not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
Atty Bergner states that his client is in custody.
Court will not authorize a warrant today as the defendant is in custody.
Case to be adjourned.

BY THE COURT:
No warrant will be issued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
